byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and HENRY FOUNTAIN

abstract: California lawmakers and Gov Jerry Brown say they will counter incoming Trump administration's climate skepticism by working directly with other countries and states in fight against climate change; some worry about backlash from federal government and negative impact on business in state that already has country's most advanced environmental policies.

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: An elevated role on climate change is a sign of how California, one of the world’s 10 largest economies, plans to resist the incoming administration’s policies.
snippet: An elevated role on climate change is a sign of how California, one of the world’s 10 largest economies, plans to resist the incoming administration’s policies....

headline.main: California, at Forefront of Climate Fight, Won’t Back Down to Trump
headline.print_headline: At Forefront of Climate Fight, California Plans an Offensive
